subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Bloody Mary and Ouija
author: dc3644@aol.com
full_text:
--part1_81d52.1777bb74.38ff62fe_boundary
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="UTF-8"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
Content-Language: en

Mediums go into a meditative or trance like state when they channel. It is =
 
in many ways similar to hypnosis. The brainwave patterns lower allowing 
=
easier  access to the sub-conscious. Who is to say that the entities are no=
t  
communicating messages through the sub-conscious? It would be interesti=
ng to  
test it using a multitude of equipment including the ghost box tech=
nology. 
In  many ways the messages that comes through such tools of divina=
tion are 
up for as  much question as some skeptics believe the ghost boxes=
 are nothing 
more than a  matrixing of audio.
 
 
In a message dated 4/20/=
2010 11:06:05 A.M. Pacific Daylight Time,  
april@abercrombieghostresearch.=
com writes:

 
 
 
I have yet to even witness the planchette move on it's o=
wn accord.

I  have conducted experiments using my gadgets - EMF, Temp gaug=
es, 
Recording  devices...I have yet to get a single hit on any one of thos=
e devices 
during a  Ouija session, even when I have asked the "entity" to =
do so, to which 
it  always agrees.

I would agree with John and others. I =
think it is far  more plausible that 
the Ouija board is nothing more then =
us talking to  ourselves. But again, I 
am always open to the opportunity t=
o be proven  wrong.


On Tue, Apr 20, 2010 at 11:55 AM, April Abercrombie  =

<_april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr_ (mailto:april@abercrombieghostresear=
ch.com) >  wrote:

I am open to the possibility  of real spirit communicati=
on through devices 
such as the Ouija board,  however I have yet to witness=
 it.  
 



On Tue, Apr 20, 2010 at 11:07 AM, Frank Sumption  
<_purplealie=
ngirl@purpleali_ (mailto:purplealiengirl@...) > wrote:


 
 
 
I have=
 to ask--How much experience do you have using the quija  board, 
and/or ot=
her methods?
 
 There is no shortage of people that give their opinions on =
how  these 
communications work, there is a shortage of people that honestl=
y  understand. 
 
 Yes, you can get get operator influence with any of thes=
e  methods, but it 
seems too tempting for the skeptic/debunker to throw al=
l  out as if it's 
all explained. Could it be that you own mind has access =
to  levels you are not 
aware of, perhaps spiritual contacts, or higher lev=
els  of being?


I think it's a bit of everything, there is external contac=
t,  and there is 
some of just the mind talking to itself through these  me=
thods. I have 
always said you have to be careful that you don't create  th=
e evidence you are 
looking for, but I am conveniently ignored. 
 
 
 F-S

=

On Tue, Apr 20, 2010 at 9:26 AM, John S <_phenom_investigatorphenom_inv_ 
=
(mailto:phenom_investigator@...) > wrote:


 
 
 
 
As has been said,=
 one of  the most likely explanations  for the Ouija is 
the working of the=
 mind.
What is somewhat at issue, as is so often the case when discussing  =

apparent discarnate 
communications, is the actual source of the apparent =
 intelligence.
 
Micromuscular reactions do indeed appear to be one source =
of the  Ouija 
when operators are
in contact with the planchette. But this =
is only one category of  Ouija 
interactions. There is
another completely d=
ifferent category where no operator is touching  the 
board or the planchet=
te,
and yet it moves and remains in motion, often changing directions  or 
=
flying off the board. This
type of activity is more akin to psychokinesis, =
the mind affecting  the 
environment.
 
Both types of activity could be med=
iated in the mind of a living  operator, 
and in fact modern
parapsychology=
 research suggest this is the most reasonable  explanation. 
But again the =

source of the information thus presented is at question and is  currently =

unknown.
 
Against this backdrop it would seem that it would be quite  dif=
ficult to 
demonstrate with
any clarity or precision that any specific indi=
vidual (living or  deceased) 
was indeed affecting
the Ouija (or any other =
device for that matter). It would all come  down to 
beliefs which is the
b=
est we can hope for at this time.
 
So 'scientific' proof per se is off the=
 table if you define  'scientific' 
in the classic sense.
If you mean objec=
tive proof, in some way documenting activity such  as by 
video for example=
,
that is a different matter. But to be very clear, this would not be  
con=
sidered scientific proof
because you are cannot demonstrate the causation. =
You can however  document 
the effect.
 
Blood Mary (the ritual of Mary Wor=
th) is considered by most to be  
folk-legend. So it would 
be difficult, w=
ould it not, to ascertain who in fact you were  communicating
 with. And ag=
ain, 
there is a real possiblity, based on existing lab research  from the =
past 
many decades that 
you just might be communicating with yourself.
 
B=
est of luck in your endeavors!
 
-------
 

Hey guys,

I am doing some rese=
arch on the Bloody Mary  ritual and Ouija Boards. I am  
looking for anyone=
 with stories  or experiences from those that would be 
willing  to share t=
hem  - as well as any research and evidence you may have 
gathered  from  t=
hem. I am looking to bring the folklore together with the  
history, scienc=
e and  experience.

Thanks.

Dwayne  Claud

__Dwayne@DwayneClaud_Dwa_ (mail=
to:_Dwayne@...) _ 
(mailto:_Dwayne@..._ (mailto:Dwa=
yne@...) )
